When it comes to Boston Police reforms, unions are often the sticking pointMandatory drug testing for firefighters? Assignments to bicycle patrols? City officials and unions have fought over both at the bargaining table, where hard-to-track deals make it difficult to draw a line between a change in policy and a bump in pay.

After policing, a host of other systems await reformThe stark inequities that Black Americans have long endured in the criminal justice system are only the tip of the iceberg, activists say. But will the diverse coalition of protesters demanding change dig in to fight systemic racism in housing, health care, and education?
